top_categories.workout_context: West Coast Gravel rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
West Coast Gravel’s oregon coast, coastal gravel demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at West Coast Gravel when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of West Coast Gravel. Make this intensity feel like home.
Racing West Coast Gravel isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
The varied gradients at West Coast Gravel reward climbing adaptability — knowing when to sit, when to stand, and when to switch.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at West Coast Gravel — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
The Norwegian double-threshold method builds the sustained power base for West Coast Gravel — massive training stimulus without the recovery cost of VO2max work.
Cadence efficiency makes every pedal stroke at West Coast Gravel count — smooth technique reduces muscular fatigue over long distances.
West Coast Gravel’s oregon coast gravel and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
West Coast Gravel’s oregon coast gravel drains energy reserves faster than the distance suggests — durability training bridges the gap.
Low-cadence force work builds the muscular strength for West Coast Gravel’s 4,000ft of climbing — especially the grinding, low-speed ascents.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for West Coast Gravel’s 55 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at West Coast Gravel requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on oregon coast gravel to build confidence. Expect: oregon coast, coastal gravel, pacific northwest.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on TT Threshold, Gravel Specific, and Over Under to prepare you for 55 miles of oregon coast gravel in Yachats, OR.
